intro: Bonamia abscissa, commonly known as the bluebonnet, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open woods, fields, and along roadsides, reaching heights of up to 2 feet. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in terminal umbels. Bonamia abscissa is known for its early spring blooming period, making it a notable wildflower in its native habitat.
